On Thu, Mar 4, 2010 at 9:52 PM, Jorn Wildt <jw@...> wrote:

>
>=

> Craig, you are right, I know. Well, my logical mind knows. The emotional=

> part of mind has a different opinion. Damn :-)
>
> I know the feeling.  =
I also know that (from a client perspective) I
*really* do not want to unde=
rstand how the sausage factory (i.e. the server)
decided to mint the URLs f=
or this application.

Too.  Much.  Information.  :-)


> /J=F8rn
>

Craig

=
PS:  But it's all good in the long run ... if the server application change=
s
its approach to URL creation, my client is still working fine (as long as=
 I
just faithfully follow the URLs that I'm given), while all those
URL-tem=
plate folks are off reprogramming to whatever the template de jour
turns ou=
t to be.

PPS:  When I'm the server side guy instead of the client side guy=
, I think
"you mean I can mint obtuse URLs that mean something to *me* even=
 if they
don't mean anything to the client?  Sweet."

--000e0cd32f16c357b3048108d74a
